instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not work USB and TUNDERBOLT
threads.message: I made the exchange L4620,<DIODE>D4610</DIODE>/11, L4600, <DIODE>D4600</DIODE>,<RESISTOR>R9401</RESISTOR>, <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C4695</CAPACITOR> (short).Replaces the doors too.  But it didn't have an effect, I imagine it is the PCH with bad solder ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not work USB and TUNDERBOLT
threads.message:
None of USB ports working?
The small coils in series with data lines, better to bypass with tiny wires.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not work USB and TUNDERBOLT
threads.message: the I/O power port is working. Strange the two ports J4600 and J9400 do not work. I identified the <CAPACITOR>C4695</CAPACITOR> in short, it seems that it suffered a big short in this region, I think it is not worth to continue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not work USB and TUNDERBOLT
threads.message:
Do you note any damage on USB ports pins?
Any history about USB device damaging the board?
Check diode mode to ground on all USB data lines.
